intro: Madia tenella, commonly known as the slender madia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a hairy texture. Madia tenella is often found in California and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
